fullText: Huey Lewis’ discography is woven into the story with a looseness that makes Escape to Margaritaville seem downright Pulitzer-worthy.
bwwExcerpt: To distract from this baffling tale, director Gordon Greenberg’s high-energy production throws a ton of pure adrenaline at the audience. At times, it works. An exuberantly silly bubble-wrap based dance number is a delight, and Tucker’s terrifying a cappella group “The Undertones'' delivers an impressive rendition of “Give Me The Keys.” (Tucker cues up that number with the opener, “5…6…Sweater vest!”). When it truly pops off, Lorin Latarro’s lunatic choreography is actually some of the sharpest o

keyPhrases.quote: woven into the story with a looseness
makes Escape to Margaritaville seem downright Pulitzer-worthy

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The critic uses heavy sarcasm comparing this show unfavorably to another notoriously poor musical, indicating this is even worse than an already bad show.
